remarks: The property " ` J ` is an R_0 space".  A space is R_0 if any two topologically distinguishable points are separated (there is an open set containing each one and disjoint from the other).  Or in contraposition, if every open set which contains ` x ` also contains ` y ` , so there is no separation, then ` x ` and ` y ` are members of the same open sets. We have chosen not to give this definition a name, because it turns out that a space is R_0 if and only if its Kolmogorov quotient is T_1, so that is what we prove here.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 25-Aug-2015.)
